intro: Hieracium grophosiceps, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly covering on the stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite flower heads, typical of the dandelion family. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium grophosiceps is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
